name: Bengali Fish Curry
method: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper, and sauté for another minute. Add the fish fillets and water, and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the fish is cooked through. Serve hot with rice.

name: Shrimp Biryani
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, rinsed and drained
method: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper, and sauté for another minute. Add the shrimp and rice, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the shrimp is cooked through. Add the water and chicken broth, and bring to a simmer. Cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 20-25 minutes until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Korma
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
method: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the chicken, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the chicken is browned on all sides. Add the water and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. Stir in the heavy cream and cilantro, and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Mutton Curry
method: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the mutton, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the mutton is browned on all sides. Add the water and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours until the mutton is tender. Stir in the yogurt and cilantro, and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Vapa Elish with Coconut Milk
method: Clean and wash the Hilsa fish and marinate with salt and turmeric powder. In a bowl, mix coconut milk, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sliced green chilies, and salt. Take a steamer and pour 1/2 cup of water. Spread half of the coconut milk mixture on top of the marinated fish and place the fish on top of the steamer. Spread the remaining coconut milk mixture on top of the fish. Cover the lid of the steamer and steam for 10-12 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice.

name: Elish Paturi
method: Clean and wash the Hilsa fish and marinate with salt and turmeric powder. In a bowl, mix mustard paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sliced green chilies, and salt. Take a steamer and pour 1/2 cup of water. Spread half of the mustard paste on top of the marinated fish and place the fish on top of the steamer. Spread the remaining mustard paste on top of the fish. Cover the lid of the steamer and steam for 10-12 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice.

name: Shutki Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. dry fish, cut into cubes
method: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the lamb, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the lamb is browned on all sides. Add the water and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours until the lamb is tender. Stir in the yogurt and cilantro, and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice.
